actor_awards.notes: Jones was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress for 'The Bachelor Party' (1957). She won a Golden Globe for Most Promising Newcomer in 1959. She is most famously associated with the character Morticia Addams, whom she played in the 1960s TV series and the 1977 TV movie.

filmography.title: The Bachelor Party
filmography.role_description: A quirky, beatnik philosopher whom the bachelor party group encounters in Greenwich Village; a brief but scene-stealing role that earned her an Oscar nomination.
filmography.plot: A group of office workers throws a bachelor party for a colleague, leading to a night of drinking and painful self-revelation.

filmography.title: Invasion of the Body Snatchers
filmography.role_description: The wife of a writer who discovers a blank, unformed 'pod' body in her home, becoming one of the first witnesses to the alien invasion.
filmography.plot: A small-town doctor learns that the population of his community is being replaced by emotionless alien duplicates.
filmography.awards: National Film Registry: Inducted (1994); AFI: 100 Years... 100 Thrills (#47)

filmography.title: Marjorie Morningstar
filmography.role_description: The cynical, sharp-witted best friend of the title character who tragically settles for a marriage of convenience.
filmography.plot: A young Jewish woman in 1950s New York pursues an acting career and falls for a charismatic but unreliable playwright.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Supporting Actress

filmography.title: King Creole
filmography.role_description: A fallen woman and the abused mistress of a mobster who falls in love with Elvis Presley's character and tries to protect him.
filmography.plot: A young man in New Orleans gets mixed up with a local gangster and his moll while trying to make it as a singer.

filmography.title: House of Wax
filmography.role_description: The first victim of the wax sculptor, whose face becomes the model for his Joan of Arc figure; an early scream queen role.
filmography.plot: A wax sculptor who was burned in a fire rebuilds his museum using the bodies of murder victims covered in wax.
filmography.awards: None (Notable as the first color 3-D feature from a major studio)

filmography.title: The Man Who Knew Too Much
filmography.role_description: A friend of the protagonist couple who inadvertently complicates their situation in this Hitchcock thriller.
filmography.plot: An American family vacationing in Morocco stumbles upon an assassination plot and their son is kidnapped to ensure their silence.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Song ('Que Sera, Sera')

filmography.title: Last Train from Gun Hill
filmography.role_description: The mistress of a powerful cattle baron who aids a marshal in his quest to bring the baron's son to justice.
filmography.plot: A marshal tries to bring the son of an old friend to justice for the rape and murder of his wife, but the father controls the town.

filmography.title: How the West Was Won
filmography.role_description: The wife of Zeb Rawlings (George Peppard), appearing in the segment about the construction of the railroad.
filmography.plot: A multigenerational saga following the Westward expansion of a family from the 1830s to the 1900s.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Screenplay, Editing, Sound; National Film Registry: Inducted (1997)

filmography.title: Halloween with the New Addams Family
filmography.role_description: Jones reprises her most iconic role as the gothic matriarch of the Addams clan in this television movie reunion.
filmography.plot: The Addams Family is prepared for the best Halloween ever, but a gang of crooks tries to ruin the fun.

filmography.title: The Seven Year Itch
filmography.role_description: A nurse who interacts with the protagonist's publisher, showcasing Jones's ability to play comedic supporting roles.
filmography.plot: A faithful husband is tempted by a beautiful neighbor while his family is away for the summer.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Tom Ewell)

filmography.title: A Hole in the Head
filmography.role_description: The bongo-playing, free-spirited girlfriend of Frank Sinatra's character, contrasting with his responsibilities as a father.
filmography.plot: A widower who runs a Miami hotel tries to keep his business afloat while raising his son and dealing with his brother.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Song ('High Hopes')

filmography.title: Ice Palace
filmography.role_description: A spirited woman who becomes a central figure in the rivalry between two men spanning decades in Alaska.
filmography.plot: The story of the development of Alaska from the end of WWI to statehood, focusing on the rivalry between a cannery tycoon and a pilot.

filmography.title: Career
filmography.role_description: A talent agent who has a complicated history with an aspiring actor struggling to make it in New York.
filmography.plot: An actor sacrifices everything for his career, enduring humiliation and betrayal in his quest for success.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Anthony Franciosa)

filmography.title: The Big Heat
filmography.role_description: A minor but memorable role as a woman in a bar who is burned with a cigarette, highlighting the brutality of the film's villain.
filmography.plot: A tough detective takes on a corrupt political machine and a crime syndicate after his wife is murdered.

filmography.title: Baby Face Nelson
filmography.role_description: The loyal girlfriend and partner-in-crime of the notorious gangster Baby Face Nelson.
filmography.plot: A biography of the violent 1930s gangster Baby Face Nelson, from his early days to his partnership with John Dillinger.

filmography.title: The Tender Trap
filmography.role_description: One of the many girlfriends of a swinging bachelor, showcasing Jones's aptitude for light comedy.
filmography.plot: A theatrical agent enjoying the bachelor life finds his lifestyle threatened when he meets a woman determined to marry him.

filmography.title: The Opposite Sex
filmography.role_description: A gossip columnist/playwright's wife in this musical remake of 'The Women', part of a large ensemble cast.
filmography.plot: A happily married singer discovers her husband is having an affair, leading to divorce and a battle to win him back.

filmography.title: Eaten Alive
filmography.role_description: The eccentric madam of a rural brothel who encounters the killer hotel owner in this cult horror film by Tobe Hooper.
filmography.plot: A psychotic redneck who owns a dilapidated hotel in rural Texas feeds his guests to his pet crocodile.

filmography.title: Heaven with a Gun
filmography.role_description: A saloon owner who shares a past with a gunfighter-turned-preacher.
filmography.plot: A gunfighter becomes a preacher in a small town and tries to settle a conflict between cattlemen and sheep herders without violence.

filmography.title: Sail a Crooked Ship
filmography.role_description: The girlfriend of a crook who gets involved in a bumbling plan to steal a ship.
filmography.plot: A crook plans to use a mothballed Liberty Ship for a bank robbery getaway, but he needs someone to fix the engine.

filmography.title: A Ticklish Affair
filmography.role_description: A supporting role as the sister of the main character (Shirley Jones) in this romantic comedy.
filmography.plot: A Navy commander investigates distress signals from a house, only to find a widow and her three sons using a blinker light.

filmography.title: Make Haste to Live
filmography.role_description: A supporting role in this noir thriller about a woman haunted by her criminal husband.
filmography.plot: A newspaper editor tries to hide her past from her daughter and the town when her gangster husband is released from prison seeking revenge.

filmography.title: Desirée
filmography.role_description: A French socialite in the court of Napoleon Bonaparte.
filmography.plot: The story of Desiree Clary, a millinery clerk who becomes Napoleon's first love and eventually the Queen of Sweden.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Art Direction, Best Costume Design

filmography.title: Shield for Murder
filmography.role_description: A deaf mute woman who becomes a witness in a corruption case involving a dirty cop.
filmography.plot: A crooked police detective kills a bookie and steals his money, then tries to cover his tracks as his own department closes in.

filmography.title: Good Luck, Miss Wyckoff
filmography.role_description: One of Jones's final film roles, appearing in this controversial drama set in the 1950s.
filmography.plot: A sexually repressed teacher at a girls' school begins an affair with a black janitor, leading to tragedy and ostracization.

filmography.title: Color Me Dead
filmography.role_description: The secretary and love interest of a man who has been poisoned and has only days to find his killer.
filmography.plot: A man discovers he has been poisoned with a slow-acting toxin and spends his final hours hunting down his murderer.
